summary: Gerald P. Hamilton was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list Hamilton's name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. He appears in payroll certifications from April 1978 to January 1979. The documents do not specify Hamilton's exact role within the SCAS, but they indicate he was a paid staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: Gerald P. Hamilton's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his contribution are not detailed in these documents.
